intro: Saururus natans, commonly known as floating bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It is characterized by its unique, floating leaves that are often covered in tiny, bladder-like structures used for trapping prey. The plant is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, which includes other carnivorous plants. Saururus natans thrives in still or slow-moving waters, where it can anchor itself with its root system. Its presence indicates a healthy, nutrient-rich aquatic ecosystem.
